page.title: 04Harborne Branch R'way(12)
page.content: The{first train}ran on this line in {1874.}People could travel in comfort from the{suburbs to their work in {B'ham.}The line closed in{1963}because it was not profitable. It became{overgrown}and used as a {rubbish dump.}Fortunately a group of {volunteers}were able to transform the line between{1975-81 into the Harborne {Walkway. The old route is now used for{walking {dogs, cycling and jogging. It}is an attractive and picturesque area with many{trees and wild flowers}growing there. The railway bridges are still standing. There are some old sleepers and an old L.M.S. sign by Park Hill bridge.{Unfortunately}there have been news stories of{mugging and glue {sniffing}along the pathway which spoil the amenity to some extent.
